results.title: Touring Korea
results.brief_description: Blessed with a rich cultural legacy and spectacular beauty, Korea is blending change with tradition. See Seoul, Chejudo, Pusan, Kyongju, Mt Soraksan, Dragon Valley, Panmunjon and Olympic sites.
results.description: Blessed with a rich cultural legacy and spectacular beauty, Korea is blending change with tradition. See Seoul, Chejudo, Pusan, Kyongju, Mt Soraksan, Dragon Valley, Panmunjon and Olympic sites.

results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Touring Indonesia
results.brief_description: Indonesia, the land of many islands, is geographically unique. The land area, of almost 2,000,000 square kilometres, is made up of a myriad of islands : Kilimantan; the second largest in the world, Sumatra, Java, Sulawesi, Irian Jaya, the famous Bali and many other islands, some barely the size of a city square, dispersed along the equator, stretching from Sabang to Meranke. Indonesia is an exciting blend of Hindu, Buddhist, Muslim, Chinese and Dutch cultures.

results.title: Touring Australia
results.creator_credit: Eddie Moses, John Richardson, Film Australia and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: An informative and entertaining film that combines an overall perspective of Australia with fascinating stories that relate to special places, individuals, events and recreational activities. These stories form the fabric of the film, stories about the historic Rocks area of Sydney, the Great Barrier Reef, the colourful Ghan railway, the mystical Ayers Rock and the world-famous Sydney Opera House. Touring Australia touches on Australia’s history - colonial heritage, the struggle for independence and unique position beside the states of Asia. It also shows the timelessness of its land mass, special animals and the blending of many cultures. We see the great modern cities of Australia, the enchanting wilderness places from Kakadu to the Top End.

results.title: Tough on two wheels
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Film Partnership
results.brief_description: Motor-cycles and the people who ride them, showing the variety of ways in which motor-cycles are used in Britain from everyday uses for business and pleasure to the thrills of the speedway and the Wall of Death. Includes sequences of the Isle of Man, T.T., Silverstone and the 1954 International Six Days Trial.

results.title: Tough at the top: business management styles
results.creator_credit: Robyn Holdsworth, Image Link and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: This program features five short acted scenarios demonstrating different business management styles. Each situation is analysed and the likely outcomes of each management approach is examined. Also highlighted is the issue that each manager is different and that no manager uses only one of these styles - they adopt different styles based on the circumstances of each situation faced. Management styles discussed include: consultative; laissez-faire; autocratic; participative and persuasive. Video support notes included. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary students.

results.brief_description: This video follows the events of the 1954 Redex Reliability Trial and shows scenes from the 1953 trial.

results.title: Touch the Sun : Top enders (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Alice, a runaway from home, meets on the road Nick, an Aboriginal boy in pursuit of his uncle. Stealing a car they traverse a treacherous stretch of desert road. When the car runs out of petrol they set out on foot, only to become lost. With the harsh desert conditions threatening their survival, Alice and Mick reflect on their actions and their families from which they have fled.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun : The Gift (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Nicos and Sofia, two city kids, strike it lucky in a lottery. Their prize is five hundred hectares of beautiful bushland in Western Australia. Together with their grandfather the children travel West to discover the mystery and magic of their land. However the children discover a darker side to their new found fortune.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Cox, Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Australian Children’s Television Foundation
